belief: Enterprise software is highly saturated for obvious, large user-base use-cases.
The barrier of entry for software is very low. This leads to a lot of competition.
The growth rate of the internet during the 1990s, and the commercial opportunity that created, has not been seen since.
There is a limit to how much of human life we want to be virtual.
The most durable and profitable companies have a physical component. Nvidia and Apple are the prime examples. Hardware provides a strong moat.
Enterprise value requires predictable, scalable and profitable revenue.
There is a self-regulating relationship between cost of capital, attractiveness of a market, sustained profitability and competition.
Information that is digitized quickly becomes a commodity.
Unique information is a critical source of competitive advantage.
Superior execution is more important than being first when starting a company.
Building the best team possible team is the most powerful way to ensure superior execution.
Be a perfectionist and obsess about details. Always try to improve execution.
Extracting high marginal-value information by sampling reality.
Always play the long game. When in doubt, focus further out.
The marginal cost of happiness is very high. Once you have a secure life, money becomes an abstract concept.
Focus on what people need, not what they ask for. Most people ask for the wrong things. A lot also do not know what they need.
